alert.note: Alert for Malibu Coast; Ventura County Beaches; Ventura County Inland Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued November 22 at 2:22PM PST until November 24 at 8:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR WESTERN LOS ANGELES COUNTY AND EASTERN VENTURA COUNTY MOUNTAINS AND VALLEYS FROM 1 AM THURSDAY THROUGH 11 AM FRIDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR THE MALIBU COASTAL STRIP WESTWARD TO THE VENTURA COUNTY COASTAL PLAIN FROM 8 AM THROUGH 8 PM THURSDAY... . High confidence in a moderate to strong Santa Ana wind event expected late Wednesday night through Friday morning. This Santa Ana event will be a bit more out of the east than recent events leading to more of a focus on the western San Fernando Valley and western portions of the Santa Monica mountains. This orientation typically provides more widespread gusty winds into coastal areas of Ventura County as well. Wind gusts are expected to peak in the 40 to 55 mph range except up to 65 mph for favored mountain and valley areas. These winds combined with critically low relative humidity values ranging between 5 and 15 percent provide about a 70 percent chance of critical fire weather conditions starting early Thursday morning, peaking in extent and intensity late morning into the afternoon, and possibly continuing through Friday morning for wind prone areas. There is a smaller window of critical conditions for coastal areas along and west of Malibu into Coastal Ventura County centered on the daytime Thursday. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY NORTHEAST WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE MALIBU COASTAL STRIP WESTWARD INTO THE VENTURA COUNTY COASTAL PLAIN... * Winds...Northeast winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts of 45 to 55 mph possible. Strongest Thursday morning. * Relative Humidity...Humidity levels mostly in the 5 to 15 percent range. * Impacts...If fire ignition occurs there could be rapid spread of wildfire that would lead to a threat to life and property.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are likely to occur in the coming days. Residents near wildland interfaces should prepare now on what to do if a wildfire breaks out. See readyforwildfire.org and wildfirerisk.org for information..
